paper_abstract: HIGH-LEVEL SYNTHESIS FROM OPENCL HAS SHOWN SIGNIFICANT POTENTIAL, BUT CURRENT APPROACHES CONFLICT WITH MAINSTREAM OPENCL DESIGN METHODOLOGIES. THE AUTHORS INTRODUCE A BACK-END SYNTHESIS APPROACH FOR POTENTIALLY ANY OPENCL TOOL. IT USES VIRTUAL COARSE-GRAINED RECONFIGURATION CONTEXTS TO SPEED UP COMPILATION BY 4,211 x AT A COST OF 1.8 x SYSTEM RESOURCE OVERHEAD, WHILE ENABLING 144 x FASTER RECONFIGURATION TO SUPPORT DIFFERENT KERNELS AND RAPID CHANGES TO KERNELS.
paper_title: FAST, FLEXIBLE HIGH-LEVEL SYNTHESIS FROM OPENCL USING RECONFIGURATION CONTEXTS
